alert.note: Alert for Greene (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 23 at 10:36PM CDT until September 24 at 4:00AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 AM CDT SUNDAY FOR GREENE COUNTY... At 1036 PM CDT, Emergency management reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Numerous water rescues are underway throughout Springfield. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen in the last hour. The expected rainfall rate is 2 to 4 inches in in the next hour. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Springfield, Republic, Battlefield, Strafford, Willard, Ash Grove, Brookline, Glidewell, Ebenezer, Galloway, Bois D`arc, Cave Springs, Turners and Bassville. This includes the following low water crossings... Wilson`s Creek at Farm Road 150, Sac River at County Road 1247, Clear Creek at Farm Road 87, Wilson Creek at Farm Road 156 and Wilson Creek at Farm Road 146. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...2-4 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
